utterance: I don't think The Elder Scrolls Online is anything great, but I didn't hate it either. On the one hand it's an MMORPG which is a genre I tend to enjoy, but on the other it's made by ZeniMax Online Studios which is a developer I dislike.

name: The Elder Scrolls Online
utterance: The Elder Scrolls Online doesn't really stand out from it's peers in either a good or a bad way. I normally love MMORPGs, but the first person perspective was the wrong choice for the game.

name: The Elder Scrolls Online
utterance: ESO is an okay first person MMORPG, I just wish it lived up to the series' legacy better.

name: The Elder Scrolls Online
utterance: I know most people really like the PC game The Elder Scrolls Online, but I thought it was just OK. First person games are not my favorite.

name: The Elder Scrolls Online
utterance: i was kind of underwhelmed with the Elder Scrolls online. i guess that's what happens when yo utake a traditionally single player first person RPG series and make a PC MMO out of it.

name: The Elder Scrolls Online
utterance: I liked the convenience of The Elder Scrolls Online being on Steam, but the M rating turned me off a bit and made the experience rather mediocre.

name: The Elder Scrolls Online

name: StarCraft

name: StarCraft

utterance: Life is Strange is a good game. I have a fondness for games released in 2015 like it, and it's for the PC which is my preferred platform.

name: Life is Strange
utterance: Life is Strange was a pretty good M rated game, it handled the themes well and I loved grabbing it on Steam.

name: Life is Strange
utterance: I absolutely love M rated games that can explore a lot of deep themes, but I disdain Steam and don't want to play games there. That's why I thought Life is Strange was a good game, but I wouldn't quite describe it as excellent.

name: Life is Strange

name: Life is Strange
utterance: After Remember Me, I thought that Dontnod was a mediocre studio, but their performance on 2015's Life is Strange really changed my mind, such a nice game.
